sourceOfFunds.purpose: This period is Covid-19 Pandemic, so Bread and Life is responding to COVID19 crisis by reaching out to poor and marginalized communities in India. In wake of the Lockdown due to Covid-19, lot of daily wage workers, migrant workers, beggars, and poor people who have lost their livelihood are suffering with hunger and are waiting for someone to help them. At this moment, Every day, we are distributed Rice, Vegetables, Groceries and Cooking oils. Also distributing cooked meals on daily basis.

This is Covid-19 Second wave peiod, hence we are extended and concentrated on public necessary commodities. we have got some funds from local donas and we are distributed food and vegetable and rice to the poor communities which are below poverty line. Also we are on skill development in computers training, Tailoring, and Feeding centers for children.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: C.V.S Krishnamurthy teja Charities is a non profitable organization registered in the year 1997 under the Act of 1882 at tirupati. The objectives of trust are: 1) To establish aid and maintain education at all stages for the promotion of Dental, Paramedical, engineering, Law, commerce and Sciences for diffusion of useful knowledge in Andhra Pradesh . 2) To give food, water and medical relief to the poor and ols age pensions. 3) To promote and maintain Research for and advancement of scientific and technical knowledge trust established Research cell. 4) To pay school and college fees, provide clothing, books to the needy students and to give scholarships to enable poor boys and girls irrespective of caste , to pursue their education and provided meritorious awards and rewards for outstanding personalities. 5) To uplift the knowledge of in rural area by conducting social and economic welfare programs. 6) To arrange, organize and patronize by providing finance for marriage of poorer section community and also arrange for funeral and obsequies for orphan. 7) To organize camps for handicapped persons and assists them in providing artificial limbs and finance for their education, employment and other activities. 8) To construct in the name of trust , special awards for best teachers for their outstanding performance in their respective schools, doctors for their proper medicare for poorer sections. 9) To adopt a panchayat, village or any rural area for maintenance of education, medical aid or uplift of poor and needy. 10) To meet the present day technologies trust has organized workshops on computer fundamentals and internet. 11) To bring joy and harmony in the families of downtrodden community trust is organizing samuhika vivahalu, samuhika annaprasana, samuhika srimanthalu every year.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1.Climate Smart Agriculture Executed pilots in 16 villages of Achampet Tq TS. Established Climate Monitoring Stations, organized Crop water budgeting exercises, developed context specific practices through pilots during 2016-10. Farmers were trained through FFS, Organic farming. Enhanced crop productivity, saved water and improved soil health. 2. NRM, Watersheds Developed 12 watersheds in Gadwal Tq. Executed plans. Improved yields of crops, milk, meat, farmers income. 3. Livelihoods Mapped resources, infrastructure and livelihoods in 16 villages, Achampet, TS. Prepared plans for improvement and executed activities. Observed significant improvement in people livelihoods. 4. Land and Water management Prepared status in Mbnr district, matched with existing technologies. Facilitated resources to manage. 5. Ground water Formed Water Management Committees at habitation, federated at Hydrological Unit. Capacitated to monitor, use water efficiently. Water users were trained on FFS, Farmer Water Schools in 16 villages, Mbnr district under APFAMGS Project supported by FAO. 6. Tank management Final Evaluation of KS-CBTMP during 2009. Stud conducted on lakes status in Hyderabad funded by HMDA. GoAP 7. River Basin Management CARE has prepared River Basin Profile. Prepared Integrated River Basin Plan for Wangchu River in Bhutan. Organized several meetings. Prepared report during 2008. 8. Irrigation management Water Users been organized into groups in 12 tanks, trained, facilitated to plan, execute. Executed in 12 tanks around Achampet Tq. In TS. 9. Child Labor Education Rescued child labor from seed production farms, provided residential education facilities, mainstreamed into residential schools, supported for continued education of about 1350 children in 15 years. RBC was visited by CM Sri N Chandrababu Naidu. CARE got awards thrice by District collector. Worked with identified Government schools in AP, TS, KS, Maharastra, Gujarat states. provided support in 6 years to improve attendance, children performance. Project funded by Monsanto company. 10. Urban slum development Solid waste management- Developed slum specific plans for 23 slums, funded by HMDA, Hyderabad. Executed social development activities in 18 slums. Contributed for Hussainsagar lake protection. 11. Vocational training Skill development- adolescent boys, girls were been trained on vocations and supported for practicing. 12. Women, Children, Tribal Formed SHGs, FPOs facilitated execution of programs in more than 100 villages. 13. Health Executed RCH program in Ija Mandal of Mbnr district. Organized women groups, health camps over 5 years. 14. Participatory Rural Appraisal About 250 participants trained on PRA. 15. Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation Studied- Assessments made about Impact of Agril., Horti. and Agri-business Interventions in APCBTMP, Submitted reports during 2015-16. 16. Preparation of Comprehensive Dist. Agriculture Dev Plans North Goa, South Goa, State Plan- Organized consultation workshops, prepared plans for 5 years period. Formed planning committees at village, block, district level in 2011-12. Project was financed by Director, DoA, Govt. Of Goa. 17. Preparation of Bio Diversity Registers Kadapa, Kurnool, Ananthapur, Chittur Districts. Formed BDG, trained, organized PRA, collected data, presented in Grama sabha, prepared bio diversity reports. 18. Evaluation study of Forest Development Agencies projects in Schendurney, Neyyar, Peppar Divisions in Kerala State National Afforestation Program, Finalized reports, submitted to CCF.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HANDS has been conducted many Development actitivities in rural areas as follows; 1.Natural forest Regeneration program, 2. Sustainable agriculture, 3.Women and Children development, and 4. HIV prevention program. We have been protecting 10,000 acres of forest creenery under Natural Forest Regeneration program. Under Agriculture programs we are providing seed for 50,000 acres. 500 landless women have got 900 acres assignment land under land distribution program by the Govt. of AP. Protecting children from their issues by the support of 1098 toll free number. 2560 HRGs have been protecting from the sexual diseases under HIV prevention program. These are the major Activities and Achievements.

NAVADHANYA is a system of agriculture for drought prone areas like Ananthapuramu. It is a tradition and practiced by farmers up to 1970. By the promotion of chemical agriculture, it has disturbed and vanished in the area. Due to this, the agriculture land decreased its productive capacity. In these circumstances the HANDS organization has started its work to words reducing of Drought rescue for the farming communities in the district.

ngoList.title: Icha Foundation
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Registered Trust Deed in 2010  Icha Foundation adopted 5 mentally and physically challenged orphan and abandoned kids  Established a campus of 1 acres in village kondakurla around 54 kms from Visakhapatnam. Funds were raised from family and well-wishers and friends.  Shifted the Foundation to the Campus and added one more specially abled child from the nearby village of Kondakurla.  Built and established rapport with the Village and community and leaders in village Kondakurla  Got Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA)  Installed Solar Power Renewable for the Total Campus needs  Built and established a Physiotherapy Centre with a running facility and in-house Physiotherapist working full time for Icha Foundation for all the kids  Facilities like speech therapy introduced in 2014  Built and expanded the staff and children of the Icha Foundation within 5 years from 3 to 15 mentally and physically challenged orphan kids.  Severe Physical destruction of the campus during Hud-Hud and funds were raised for repair and rework.  Nearby donation of 1 acre land by Spanish sponsor in 2015 for establishment of a school with integrated rural children and children with severe disability.  Focus on building self-sustaining campus with investment in cows and livestock for food and milk requirement.  Awareness and medical camps two being organised in 2015 and 2016 in which nearby villages rural communities and children came around 700. This was a joint collaboration between Icha Foundation and Indian Navy  Fund raising event organised in Visakhapatnam in collaboration with razzmatazz event management company  Present donors are Feel Well garments, Flash Forge, Affiliation with kind from NAWA and Indian Navy.
